result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher W Melville was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

civilJdgmts.propDescr: Civil Judgment for Restitution and Surcharges and Court Costs.

miscConds.notes:
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.
DNA Surcharge/Sample waived based on date of violation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.  Inform Agent of all prescriptions.

No contact with: any of the victims listed in the criminal complaint with the exception to write letters of apologies to all of the victims.  Maintain full-time employment and/or school combinaiton.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent. 
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

To be determined.
PER RESTITUTION HEARING ON 1/11/2017 - COURT SETS RESTITUTION IN THE AMOUNT OF $12,580.00 FOR EMC INSURANCE.

timeConds.notes: To be performed as a condition of probation.

supervisions.notes: See Count 2 for Conditions of Probation.

miscConds.notes: Costs and DNA Surcharge/Sample are waived based on date of violation.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Waukesha County DTC Diversion Contract

Defendant Christopher W Melville in court with attorney Katie B. Bricco.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Counts 2 and 3. Court accepts plea as, knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily made. Court withholds entry of judgment as the defendant has been accepted into DTC. Court approves the Waukesha County DTC Diversion Contract and forwards the file to DTC.  Counts #1 and #4 are dismissed and read in.  The Defendant is to report DAILY to Day Report Center starting Monday, November 16, 2015 until the order is modified by Judge Carter through Drug Treatment Court.
Plea hearing on November 9, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
